rounds.response:
I am in the Big Blind with 9♣ 7♣ (suited connectors). The Small Blind has completed to 20 chips (full 20-chip bet, making the current bet 20). I have already posted 10 chips and must decide between folding, calling the additional 10 chips, or raising.

9⋄7⋄ is only a medium-strength hand heads-up. I’m out of position post-flop. Raising here risks bloating the pot out of position with a speculative hand. A call keeps the pot small and lets me see a flop with suited connectors that can make strong draws. Folding is too tight for a suited one-gapper in a heads-up pot.

[Call]

rounds.response:
Looking at this turn texture:

- My hand: 9♣ 7♣ with the board 5♥ 9♠ Q♠ 3♦  
  I have one pair, nines, with a medium kicker.  
- The flop action tells a story: OOP P1 called my 75% pot c-bet multi-way (after both limping pre-flop).  
- This board is quite static—no obvious straight draws, flush only on the flop got there—yet villain still peeled once.  
- On the blank 3♦ turn we drop to virtually 0% equity against Qx and are way behind sets/overpairs. Our showdown value vs single-pair queens is razor thin; at best we chop. Value-betting again is lighting money on fire.  

I take the free card and keep the pot small.

[Check]
